text: hello this is chef john from food
whooshes calm and pardon the audio but
i'm on the road in seattle at the
international food bloggers conference
and i didn't plan on shooting any video
but then I went to Pike Place
Seattle's famous market and they have
just the most incredible seafood
especially salmon I've ever seen so I
was thinking I need to taste that and I
think I'm gonna try to cook in the hotel
room so in addition to the salmon I got
a lemon and some tarragon because my
game plan was to use the coffee kit in
the room to sort of poach the salmon in
like a tarragon teal most or at least
that was the plan so what I did is I
placed the salmon and the cup I knew the
heat I had to work with wasn't going to
be substantial so I made sure they cut
it nice and thin all right and then I
just layered it with some tarragon black
pepper and salt from the room-service
people thank you room service people all
right so I stuffed the salmon in there I
placed it in the coffee maker I tried to
estimate how much water I would need I
poured it in turned it on and the hot
water dripped why am I giving a
play-by-play I have a coffee maker you
guys know how it works
hot water dripped in oh and one tip for
you hotel room photographers when you're
filming salmon cooked in a coffee kit
cup don't get too close I totally missed
the money shot here but anyway that's
okay so I removed it from the coffee
maker and I let it sit there exactly
four minutes why four minutes I have no
idea was a pure guest then I drained and
much to my amazement I had some
unbelievably delicious salmon I mean it
doesn't get any fresher than that it was
actually cooked perfectly little lemon
little extra salt it was fantastic
so happy I mean that made for a really
cool lunch anyway a little quick and
dirty video from Seattle check out the
site if you want there's no recipe there
but you know go check it out anyway and
as always enjoy
[Music]
